value.title: Power BI Quick Tip: the Formula Bar in Power Query
value.excerpt: Often you do the transformation in Power Query using the graphical interface, but having the formula bar visible, makes it much easier to understand or change the transformations. In this short blog and video, I'll explain that. read my blog with more details here: https://radacad.com/power-bi-quick-tip-the-formula-bar-in-power-query

value.title: Power BI Theme   Customize Colors Fonts and Visual Appearance for Multiple Objects
value.excerpt: If you build a report for an enterprise, you might be limited to use the organization-approved colors. It is also useful to have your reports following a template of colors, and fonts, which might look like your signature of the report. In Power BI, you can do that with Theme. In this article, I’ll explain
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/K83vD6DwFvI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI User Access Levels   Build and Edit are different
value.excerpt: Often I have seen Power BI users have access to the areas that they shouldn’t. In Power BI, you can share a report with a user just for view only, or give them access to view and built, or to Edit. These are all different levels of access. Build access is the one that is often is confused with Edit.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZsZkYOAcABI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. However, if you have a dynamic range of date, and you want to find the previous period of that dynamic selection, then Parallel Period can’t give you the answer. As an example; if the user selected

value.title: Quick Measures in Power BI You don’t have to write DAX

value.title: Relative Date Slicer in Power BI   Simple yet Powerful
value.excerpt: If you are using a date slicer in your Power BI report, a relative date slicer is one of the options to consider for sure. This is a very simple type of slicer to use, but very effective in terms of options that it provides for the user to slice and dice the data. Let’s check it out in this short video.

value.title: Remove Duplicate Does not Work in Power Query for Power BI Here is the Solution
value.excerpt: One of the most common transformations in Power Query is the Remove Duplicates. This transformation is used in many scenarios, one of the examples, is to create a dimension table with unique IDs in it, so can be used as the source of a one to many relationships to fact tables in the relationship diagram

value.excerpt: For a visualization tool, one of the important factors is to filter the data for a specific reporting requirement. value.title: Share Different Visual Pages with Different Security Groups in Power BI

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. value.title: Handling customers with the same name in Power BI

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Rolling average with working days in DAX

value.title: Set functions in DAX UNION, INTERSECT, and EXCEPT

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Understanding the IN operator in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn the IN operator in DAX, which simplifies logical conditions by checking whether a certain value belongs to a list of values. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
